Description: Postcard; printed paper; photograph showing the exterior and adjacent street by the Blue Mosque, Cairo.
Curator's comments: Used. The message is dated 16th February, and the card is postmarked Cairo on the following day, 1939. The message is from an individual with the initials C.B.K. and reads: "Our days are as crowded as the streets & I wish I were [?]. It really is a [?] as the guide books say. We have been here four days & leave tomorrow by Nile steamer for Luxor. It is hard to tear oneself from the hotel (Shepherds) balcony. It's like a constant [?] of strange vehicles, animals & people".
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Cairo (city), Blue Mosque
Acquisition notes: Purchased from Terry, Antiques Garage, New York, 27th April 2013.
